projects.title: Home Lab Kubernetes Cluster
projects.shortDescription: Enterprise-grade Kubernetes infrastructure with 9 HP Spectre SFF PC nodes, Calico CNI, and GitLab CI/CD.
projects.fullDescription:
• Architected an enterprise-grade Kubernetes infrastructure comprising 9 HP Spectre SFF PC nodes running Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, implementing network segmentation using Calico CNI.
• Engineered robust high-availability configurations with a distributed control plane, load balancing, and resource scheduling algorithms to optimize workload distribution and ensure system reliability.
• Implemented infrastructure-as-code principles using Hashicorp Packer and a GitLab CI/CD pipeline for zero-downtime deployments.

projects.title: Credit Card Fraud Detection
projects.shortDescription: Architected and benchmarked ML models for fraud detection, improving precision and reducing false positives.
projects.fullDescription:
• Architected and benchmarked efficacy of four machine learning models to detect anomalies evaluating their performance across six metrics.
• Engineered an innovative feature selection methodology that achieved breakthrough performance with a 23% precision improvement and approximately 30% reduction in false positives compared to industry-standard systems, enabling mission-critical real-time transaction analysis for financial institutions.
• Pioneered novel approaches to imbalanced dataset handling, implementing advanced sampling techniques and custom loss functions that dramatically improved model robustness when detecting rare fraudulent transactions within massive legitimate transaction volumes.
• Published as first author in prestigious international journal: Study of Machine Learning Algorithms for Credit Card Fraud Detection (IRJMETS Vol 4. 2022), contributing significant advancements to the field of financial security and algorithmic fraud detection.

projects.title: Fuzzy Logic-Based Fingerprint Recognition System
projects.shortDescription: Advanced biometric authentication system using Fuzzy C-Means clustering and statistical features for fingerprint segmentation and enhancement.
projects.fullDescription:
• Developed an innovative fingerprint recognition system integrating Fuzzy C-Means (FCM) clustering algorithm with statistical feature extraction for enhanced biometric authentication accuracy.
• Engineered advanced fingerprint segmentation methodology using fuzzy logic principles, statistical features (mean, variance, third and fourth order moments), and sliding window techniques to isolate regions of interest and eliminate background noise.
• Implemented sophisticated fingerprint enhancement algorithms utilizing frame difference techniques between original images and variance/mean fingerprint images, significantly improving minutiae detection accuracy.
• Designed and optimized clustering algorithms that outperformed traditional K-means segmentation methods, demonstrating superior accuracy in fingerprint feature extraction and classification.
• Conducted comprehensive research and development under Prof. Surekha Janrao's guidance, contributing to advancements in biometric security systems for commercial, government, and forensic applications.
• Architected complete biometric pipeline including fingerprint acquisition, segmentation, enhancement, minutiae extraction, orientation estimation, classification, and matching algorithms.

projects.title: Bayesian Networks Inference Engine
projects.shortDescription: Command-line probabilistic inference engine implementing Bayesian Networks with conditional probability calculations and evidence-based reasoning.
projects.fullDescription:
• Developed a comprehensive Bayesian Networks inference engine in Python implementing probabilistic reasoning and conditional probability calculations using enumeration algorithms.
• Engineered sophisticated probability calculation system supporting both joint probability P(A∧B∧C∧D) and conditional probability P(Query|Evidence) computations with high precision (9 decimal places).
• Implemented robust command-line interface supporting flexible query formats with evidence variables, enabling complex probabilistic queries like P(B=true, G=false | F=false).
• Designed efficient data processing pipeline handling training data parsing, probability table generation, and dynamic variable enumeration for all possible variable combinations.
• Built comprehensive inference by enumeration algorithm that systematically considers all variable states not explicitly specified in queries, ensuring accurate probabilistic calculations.
• Architected modular codebase with specialized functions for numerical calculations (numcalc), probability enumeration, and conditional probability computation with error handling for edge cases.
• Integrated advanced features including automatic probability normalization, zero-probability handling with epsilon correction, and precise floating-point arithmetic for reliable inference results.

projects.title: Minimum Spanning Tree Algorithms on Road Networks
projects.shortDescription: Comprehensive analysis and implementation of Prim's and Kruskal's MST algorithms with real-world road network datasets and performance benchmarking.
projects.fullDescription:
• Implemented and benchmarked two fundamental graph algorithms - Prim's and Kruskal's algorithms for Minimum Spanning Tree construction using Python and NetworkX library.
• Engineered comprehensive performance analysis framework utilizing real-world road network datasets ranging from 639 nodes (Maldives) to 898,430 nodes (Tokyo) to evaluate algorithmic efficiency across different graph densities.
• Developed sophisticated data processing pipeline handling GraphML format datasets including Manhattan (4,426 nodes), New York (54,128 nodes), Los Angeles (297,333 nodes), and Tokyo road networks for realistic algorithm testing.
• Designed automated benchmarking system using Python's built-in time functions to measure and compare execution times, generating detailed performance metrics and statistical analysis.
• Created comprehensive visualization suite using Matplotlib to generate comparative graphs, original network visualizations, and MST output analysis for algorithmic performance evaluation.
• Conducted extensive algorithmic analysis demonstrating Prim's algorithm superiority for dense graphs due to adjacent node traversal efficiency, while proving Kruskal's effectiveness for sparse graphs through optimized edge sorting.
• Architected modular codebase with separate algorithm implementations (mst.py), main execution controller (main.py), and organized dataset management system with comprehensive documentation and results analysis.

projects.title: Red-Blue Nim Game with Minimax AI
projects.shortDescription: Interactive command-line game implementing Minimax algorithm with alpha-beta pruning for optimal strategy in two-pile marble game.
projects.fullDescription:
• Developed an intelligent game-playing system implementing the classic Red-Blue Nim variant with sophisticated AI opponent using Minimax algorithm and custom evaluation heuristics.
• Engineered advanced Minimax algorithm with configurable search depth and complete game tree generation, enabling optimal move selection through recursive state space exploration and strategic lookahead.
• Designed comprehensive evaluation function incorporating weighted scoring system (red marbles: 2 points, blue marbles: 3 points) with game-state analysis and winning condition prioritization for strategic gameplay.
• Implemented flexible command-line interface supporting human vs computer gameplay with customizable starting conditions, pile sizes, first player selection, and adjustable AI difficulty through depth limiting.
• Architected robust game state management system handling turn-based mechanics, move validation, win/loss detection, and real-time score calculation with clear terminal-based user interaction.
• Built intelligent evaluation heuristics that strategically balance immediate scoring opportunities with long-term winning potential, incorporating pile size optimization and endgame acceleration strategies.
• Created comprehensive game logic handling edge cases, invalid moves, and optimal termination conditions while maintaining clean separation between game rules, AI strategy, and user interface components.

projects.title: Railway e-Ticketing Management System
projects.shortDescription: Full-stack web-based railway reservation system with real-time booking, cancellation, and status tracking capabilities.
projects.fullDescription:
• Developed a comprehensive web-based railway reservation system using PHP, MySQL, and responsive front-end technologies to streamline ticket booking processes and eliminate traditional queue-based systems.
• Engineered robust database architecture using MySQL with normalized tables for trains, passengers, bookings, and seat availability, implementing efficient data retrieval and real-time status updates.
• Implemented advanced booking algorithms handling seat allocation, waiting list management, automatic confirmation upon cancellations, and PNR generation with unique ticket ID systems.
• Designed intuitive user interface with HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap framework, enabling seamless ticket booking, cancellation, status checking, and train information retrieval through any web browser.
• Built comprehensive booking validation system checking train numbers, travel dates, seat availability, and passenger details (supporting up to 10 passengers per booking with Aadhar verification).
• Integrated automatic notification system for booking confirmations, waiting list updates, and cancellation processing, with real-time database synchronization using XAMPP server environment.
• Developed administrative features for train schedule management, seat allocation tracking, and passenger record maintenance with secure PHP-based database connectivity.
